oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gargling forbidden by the Bushman mothers, for fear of evil consequences. In the Katkop dialect, by Díä!kwãin (L V.
20. 5569 rev. and 5570 rev.). Children are not allowed to 'play' at gargling, although they may wash their throats if necessary.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gargling
